poem:
**The Cost of Accord**  
  
In the quiet exchange of digits,  
currents flow across borders,  
paper continents redrawn.  
Men in polished shoes shuffle,  
seeking solace in figures.  
Yet, in the fields of Wales,  
the soil remains unmoved,  
bearing witness to deals  
that never touch  
the spirit of the land.
